info.name: Tasktrox API
info.description:
Complete API testing for Tasktrox.

## Testing Order:
1. Health Check
2. Register User
3. Login User
4. Get Current User
5. Create Project
6. Create/Manage Columns
7. Create/Manage Tasks
8. Refresh Token
9. Logout

## Variables:
- `baseUrl`: http://localhost:4000/api/v1
- `accessToken`: Auto-set after login/register
- `refreshToken`: Auto-set after login/register
- `projectId`: Auto-set after creating project
- `columnId`: Auto-set after creating column
- `taskId`: Auto-set after creating task

request.description: Verify the server is running and healthy.

Register a new user account.

**Required fields:**
- email: Valid email address
- password: Min 8 chars, 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase, 1 number
- name: User's display name

**Response:**
- 201: User created successfully with tokens
- 409: User already exists
- 400: Validation error
Attempt to register with an existing email. Should return 409 conflict.
Attempt to register with invalid email format. Should return 400 validation error.
Attempt to register with a weak password. Should return 400 validation error.

Login with existing credentials.

**Required fields:**
- email: Registered email address
- password: Account password

**Response:**
- 200: Login successful with tokens
- 401: Invalid credentials
- 400: Validation error

**Note:** Refresh token is set as httpOnly cookie
Attempt to login with wrong password. Should return 401 unauthorized.
Attempt to login with non-existent email. Should return 401 unauthorized.

Get the currently authenticated user's profile.

**Headers:**
- Authorization: Bearer <accessToken>

**Response:**
- 200: User profile data
- 401: Unauthorized (no/invalid token)

request.description: Attempt to access protected route with invalid token. Should return 401 unauthorized.

List all projects for the authenticated user.

**Response:**
- 200: Array of projects
- 401: Unauthorized

Create a new project with default columns.

**Required fields:**
- name: Project name (1-100 chars)

**Optional fields:**
- description: Project description (max 500 chars)

**Response:**
- 201: Project created with 4 default columns (Backlog, To Do, In Progress, Done)
- 400: Validation error
- 401: Unauthorized

Get a single project by ID with its columns.

**Response:**
- 200: Project with columns
- 401: Unauthorized
- 404: Project not found

Update a project's name and/or description.

**Optional fields:**
- name: New project name
- description: New description

**Response:**
- 200: Updated project
- 400: Validation error
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: Not project owner/admin
- 404: Project not found
Attempt to get a project that doesn't exist. Should return 404.

Delete a project (soft delete).

**Note:** Run this LAST after testing columns. Creates new project for subsequent tests.

**Response:**
- 200: Project deleted
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: Not project owner
- 404: Project not found

exec: // Save first column ID for subsequent tests

request.description:
List all columns for a project, ordered by position.

**Response:**
- 200: Array of columns
- 401: Unauthorized
- 404: Project not found

Create a new column in a project.

**Required fields:**
- name: Column name (1-50 chars)

**Optional fields:**
- color: Hex color (e.g., #FF5733)
- order: Position (defaults to end)

**Response:**
- 201: Column created
- 400: Validation error
- 401: Unauthorized
- 404: Project not found

Create a column at position 0 (shifts other columns).

**Note:** All existing columns will have their order incremented.

Get a single column by ID.

**Response:**
- 200: Column data
- 401: Unauthorized
- 404: Column not found

Update a column's name and/or color.

**Optional fields:**
- name: New column name (1-50 chars)
- color: New hex color (or null to remove)

**Response:**
- 200: Updated column
- 400: Validation error
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: Viewer cannot update
- 404: Column not found

Reorder a column to a new position.

**Required fields:**
- newOrder: New position (0-based index)

**Behavior:**
- Columns between old and new positions are shifted
- Moving right: columns shift left
- Moving left: columns shift right

**Response:**
- 200: Updated column with new order
- 400: Validation error
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: Viewer cannot reorder
- 404: Column not found
Attempt to get a column that doesn't exist. Should return 404.

Delete a column (soft delete).

**Note:** Remaining columns are reordered to close the gap.

**Response:**
- 200: Column deleted
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: Viewer cannot delete
- 404: Column not found

exec: // Save first task ID for subsequent tests if exists

request.description:
List all tasks for a column, ordered by position.

**Query params:**
- includeDeleted: true to include soft-deleted tasks
- priority: HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW to filter by priority
- search: Search term for title/description

**Response:**
- 200: Array of tasks
- 401: Unauthorized
- 404: Column not found

Create a new task in a column.

**Required fields:**
- title: Task title (1-200 chars)

**Optional fields:**
- description: Task description (max 5000 chars)
- priority: HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW
- dueDate: ISO 8601 datetime
- order: Position (defaults to end)

**Response:**
- 201: Task created
- 400: Validation error
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: No permission
- 404: Column not found

exec: pm.test('Task created with due date', function() {

request.description: Create a task with a due date and high priority.

Create a task at position 0 (shifts other tasks).

**Note:** All existing tasks will have their order incremented.

Get a single task by ID.

**Response:**
- 200: Task data with column info
- 401: Unauthorized
- 404: Task not found

Update a task's properties.

**Optional fields:**
- title: New task title (1-200 chars)
- description: New description (null to clear)
- priority: HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW, or null
- dueDate: ISO 8601 datetime or null to clear

**Response:**
- 200: Updated task
- 400: Validation error
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: No permission
- 404: Task not found
Clear a task's due date by setting it to null.

Reorder a task within its column.

**Required fields:**
- order: New position (0-based index)

**Behavior:**
- Tasks between old and new positions are shifted
- Moving right: tasks shift left
- Moving left: tasks shift right

**Response:**
- 200: Updated task with new order
- 400: Validation error or invalid order
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: No permission
- 404: Task not found

Move a task to a different column and/or position.

**Required fields:**
- targetColumnId: ID of the destination column
- order: Position in the destination column (0-based)

**Note:** Update targetColumnId to a different column to test cross-column moves.

**Response:**
- 200: Updated task with new column and order
- 400: Invalid target column or order
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: No permission
- 404: Task not found

List tasks filtered by priority.

**Valid values:** HIGH, MEDIUM, LOW
Search tasks by title or description.
Attempt to get a task that doesn't exist. Should return 404.

Delete a task (soft delete).

**Note:** Remaining tasks are reordered to close the gap.

**Response:**
- 200: Task deleted
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: No permission
- 404: Task not found

Bulk delete multiple tasks.

**Required fields:**
- taskIds: Array of task IDs to delete (max 50)

**Response:**
- 200: All tasks deleted successfully
- 207: Partial success (some tasks deleted, some failed)
- 401: Unauthorized

Refresh the access token using a refresh token.

**Note:** In browser, the refresh token is automatically sent via httpOnly cookie. For Postman testing, you can send it in the body.

**Response:**
- 200: New access token issued
- 401: Invalid/expired refresh token
Attempt to refresh with invalid token. Should return 401.

Request a password reset email.

**Note:** Always returns success to prevent email enumeration. Check server logs for the reset token in development.

**Response:**
- 200: Success message (always, for security)

Reset password using the token from forgot-password email.

**To test:**
1. Call Forgot Password
2. Check server logs for the reset token
3. Paste the token in this request

**Response:**
- 200: Password reset successful
- 400: Invalid/expired token
Attempt password reset with invalid token. Should return 400.

Logout the current user.

**Actions:**
- Revokes the refresh token from database
- Clears the refresh token cookie

**Response:**
- 200: Logout successful
After logout, this should still work until the access token expires (15 min). The refresh token has been revoked, so new tokens cannot be obtained.

**DEVELOPMENT ONLY** - Simulate OAuth login without going through Google.

**Required fields:**
- provider: OAuth provider name (google, apple, github)
- providerId: Unique ID from the OAuth provider
- email: User's email from OAuth provider
- name: User's display name from OAuth provider

**Optional fields:**
- avatar: URL to user's profile picture

**Behavior:**
- If user with this provider+providerId exists: logs them in
- If user with this email exists: links OAuth to existing account
- Otherwise: creates new user

**Response:**
- 201: User created/logged in with tokens
- 400: Missing required fields

**DEVELOPMENT ONLY** - Simulate Apple OAuth login.

Apple often provides a private relay email address.

item.name: DEV - Link OAuth to Existing Account

request.description:
**DEVELOPMENT ONLY** - Test linking OAuth to an existing local account.

Use the same email as an existing user (e.g., testuser@example.com from registration tests). The OAuth provider will be linked to that account.

Start real Google OAuth flow.

**Note:** This endpoint redirects to Google's login page. Open this URL in a browser to test the full OAuth flow.

**Requirements:**
- GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID and GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET must be set in .env
- Callback URL must be configured in Google Console

Test rate limiting on auth endpoints.

**Rate Limits:**
- Auth endpoints: 5 requests per 15 minutes

**To test:**
1. Run this request multiple times quickly
2. After 5 attempts, should receive 429 Too Many Requests
